conclusion: An electromagnetic railgun fire truck launches projectiles using electromagnetic propulsion for fire suppression in high-rise buildings.
Energy stored in capacitors is converted into kinetic energy through electromagnetic induction.
Setting the working voltage of capacitors achieves desired muzzle velocity.
Railgun aimed at high-rise building with horizontal distance L=60m, muzzle velocity v0=50m/s, launch angle θ=53°.
Neglect height of railgun above ground and air resistance, acceleration due to gravity g=10m/s², sin53°=0.8.
Image shows electromagnetic railgun launching projectile at angle θ from horizontal, with muzzle velocity v0=50m/s and angle θ=53°, horizontal distance L=60m.
Muzzle velocity v0=50m/s and launch angle θ=53° are given.
Using horizontal range equation L=v0 cos θ × t, find t=2 seconds.
Using vertical displacement equation y=v0 sin θ × t - 1/2 g t², find y=60 meters.
Height H at which projectile hits high-rise building is 60 meters.
